results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals of number of k step walks (each step +-1 starting from 0) which are never more than n or less than -n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..200, flattened
formula: Starting with T(n, 0) = 1, if (k-n) is negative or even then T(n, k) = 2*T(n, k-1), otherwise T(n, k) = 2*T(n, k-1)-A061897(n-1, (k-n-1)/2). So for n>=k, T(n, k) = 2^k.
xref: Cf. early rows: A000007, A016116 (without initial term), A068911, A068912, A216212, A216241, A235701.
Central and lower diagonals are A000079, higher diagonals include A000918, A028399.
